thread.title: Libby Case Shows Special Prosecutor’s Abuse

author: wsjcom
title: Libby Case Shows Special Prosecutor’s Abuse
text: Regarding your editorial “Justice for Scooter Libby” (April 14): This is a useful reminder about how past special prosecutors have acted. It isn’t that they can be guilty of misconduct, hiding relevant exculpatory evidence, but that they completely ignore their initial assignment to pursue other goals. In Mr. Libby’s case, the prosecutor knew almost from the beginning that someone else had leaked CIA agent Valerie Plame’s name to journalists. That didn’t stop him from setting off to entrap Mr. Libby many months later in an attempt to flip him and get to Vice President Dick Cheney pursuant to a political agenda that had...
